intro: Pyrenacantha batesii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces a cluster of bright red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and low maintenance requirements.
